business.headline: Want ELI scheme benefits? Make sure your UAN and Aadhaar are linked by this dateThe Employees' Provident Fund Organisation has extended the deadline for UAN activation and Aadhaar linking to bank accounts under the ELI scheme until 30 June 2025.

Are you a freelancer? 5 things to know while filing your ITRFreelancers can claim deductions for expenses directly related to their work. These include internet bills, rent for a co-working space, cost of software tools, professional fees, marketing and advertising costs, and travel expenses related to business, etc.

GST Council may remove 12% slab, shift items to 5% and 18% tax ratesThe GST Council is considering eliminating the 12% tax slab as part of efforts to streamline the tax structure, potentially moving these items to either the 5% or 18% brackets.

Dr Reddy's shares jump over 3% today. Here's whyDr Reddy's shares soar 3.54% after Alvotech partnership for Keytruda biosimilar, enhancing global reach in cancer immunotherapy and signaling growth potential in competitive biosimilar market.
What is DIGIPIN? India's new digital address system explainedThe Department of Posts has launched DIGIPIN, a geocoded digital address system aiming to improve location accuracy and service delivery.

Eternal shares continue to rally, jumps over 4%. Should you buy?By approximately 10:06 am, the company's shares had risen 4.42% to Rs 256.35 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). This marks a 12% rise over the past five trading sessions and a 6% increase over the past month. However, year-to-date, the stock remains down by over 7%.
Sensex rallies 800 points: Why is stock market rising today?As of 12:24 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex had jumped 770.31 points to reach 81,768.56. The NSE Nifty50 was also up by 230.50 points at 24,850.60.
Sensex, Nifty rise as RBI rate cut hopes lift market; pharma stocks rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 273 points to 81,271.25, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 86.55 points to 24,706.75 as of 9:29 am.
Stock market opening: Sensex, Nifty to rally today? Check key levelsGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,733.5 as of 8:00 am, signalling a strong start above Nifty50's previous close of 24,620.2.

Stocks to watch on June 5: Reliance Infra, Yes Bank, BEL, HAL, REC, Power GridAn overview of stock movements on Dalal Street today, including updates on Adani Airports, Reliance Infrastructure, and more.

Volkswagen to trim 35,000 jobs in Germany by 2030Volkswagen is planning to cut 35,000 jobs in Germany by the year 2030. To make the transition easier, Volkswagen is preparing severance packages for affected employees.
Sensex ends 261 points higher; Nifty above 24,600; Eternal gains over 3%The S&P BSE Sensex added 261 points to end at 80,998.25, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 77.70 points to close at 24,620.20.

Government seeks lower energy costs for backing green steel incentives: ReportIndia's finance ministry calls for lower energy prices to facilitate incentives for green steel production, amidst concerns over high green hydrogen costs and inflation.
ITR-1, ITR-4 filing begins for AY 2025–26: Are you eligible?The Income Tax Department has enabled online filing of ITR-1 and ITR-4 forms for the assessment year 2025-26.

RBI policy meet begins today: These stocks could rally if rate cut happensThe market is expecting a cut of 25 to 50 basis points (bps), mainly because inflation has been coming down and there are growing worries about slower economic growth.

Why China's rare earth export curbs are shaking global supply chainsChina's recent restrictions on rare earth exports are causing global industry disruptions, prompting urgent diplomatic and economic responses.

GRSE shares jump 10% today: What's fuelling the rally?GRSE shares surged by up to 10% after sealing a partnership with Norway's Kongsberg for India's first Polar Research Vessel, highlighting a pivotal moment in deep-sea research and defence shipbuilding.

Is Rs 1 crore salary still a big deal? Depends on where you live and who you askAn alumnus of IIM Ahmedabad has raised questions about the real value of a 1 crore annual salary in Mumbai. He pointed out that in areas like Borivali or Thane, a Rs 1 crore salary might still make one stand out, but in South Mumbai's boardrooms, where finance and tech executives frequently earn between Rs 1 crore and Rs 5 crore, this income is seen as average.

Trump doubles metal tariffs to 50% but skips UK. What it means for IndiaUS President Donald Trump plans to double tariffs on imported steel and aluminium, affecting global trade dynamics. The UK's exemption contrasts with challenges for India.

Did Coforge shares drop 80% today? Here's all you need to knowInvestors might have initially mistaken this adjustment for a loss. Despite the apparent drop, the stock actually opened higher at Rs 1,720.05 on Wednesday, with a 0.60% increase. It was up 1.4% on the BSE at 12:18 pm.

Are you eligible for PM-Kisan yojana? Check 20th instalment and requirementsThe upcoming 20th instalment is anticipated to be disbursed in the first or second week of June 2025. Under this scheme, farmers can receive the annual financial aid of Rs 6,000, distributed in three equal instalments of Rs 2,000 every four months.

Stop sudden tax demands: Raghuram Rajan on fixing India's business environmentRaghuram Rajan says India must fix its business environment, starting with killing off surprise tax shocks that are scaring investors and strangling the country's shot at global supply chain glory.

Explained: How India can benefit from striking trade deal with USIndia's challenge goes beyond just sealing a US trade deal, it's about finding the right balance between opening up for growth and safeguarding its own industries.

Scoda Tubes lists flat at issue price amid strong IPO subscriptionScoda Tubes saw good interest during its initial public offering (IPO) phase, which ran from May 28 to May 30, 2025. The IPO was oversubscribed by 57.37 times, highlighting strong market demand.

Trump's student visa curbs opportunity for India, says Raghuram RajanRaghuram Rajan has called the US administration's actions "unfortunate," particularly in how they undermine the long-standing academic and economic ties between the US and countries like India.
Sensex opens 144 points higher, Nifty above 24,500; Eternal up over 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 89.35 points to 80,826.86, while the NSE Nifty50 added 29.35 points to 24,606 as of 9:32 am.

India rubbed US the wrong way with arms purchase from Russia: Trump officialSpeaking at an event in Washington, US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick said that President Donald Trump deeply admires India and the two countries are going to have a great relationship together.

Nvidia overtakes Microsoft to become world's most valuable companyThis is not the first time Nvidia has reached the top. The company had earlier taken the number one spot on 24 January this year but was later overtaken.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyGift Nifty futures were trading at 24,723, as of 8:06 am, suggesting a higher opening above Nifty's previous close of 24,542.50. The anticipation of a constructive dialogue between the U.S. and China

Stocks to watch on June 4: HDFC Bank, Wipro, Ola Electric, Nestle, Yes BankExplore the latest stock market movements with major stakes sold in Yes Bank, HDFC Bank's IPO plans, and strategic advancements by companies like Wipro and Ola Electric.

Cartier confirms client data stolen in cyberattackCartier confirmed a cyberattack in which client data was stolen, joining a growing list of major brands hit by breaches, including Victoria's Secret, Marks & Spencer, and The North Face.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanCan India turn its economic momentum into lasting prosperity? As global risks loom and GDP rankings rise, Raghuram Rajan lays out what it will really take to become a developed nation.

India needs 8-9% growth to become Viksit Bharat by 2047: Raghuram RajanIn an exclusive interview with India Today TV's Consulting Editor Rajdeep Sardesai, former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan discussed India's economic outlook in uncertain global times. He emphasised the need for 8-9% growth for India to become a developed nation by 2047.
OECD cuts global growth forecast citing trade war risksThe OECD has reduced its global growth forecast to 2.9% for 2025 and 2026, attributing the slowdown to heightened trade tensions.

Credit score made easy: Check it, fix it, boost itYour credit score is mostly shaped by how timely you are with payments, missing even one EMI or credit card due can bring it down.  A score of 750 or above is considered good by most banks and lending companies.

Sensex closes 636 points lower, Nifty below 24,600; Adani Ports down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 636.24 points to close at 80,737.51, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 174.10 points to end at 24,542.

Smallcap stocks are back in action again. Should you ride the wave?Since the market's low in February 2025, the Nifty50 index has risen by 12%. But the real jump has been in the mid and smallcap space. The midcap index has gone up by 20%, and the smallcap index has climbed 22% during the same period.

Sensex tumbles 700 points: What's behind today's stock market decline?The BSE Sensex was trading 740.82 points lower at 80,632.93 at around 1:13 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 187.65 points to 24,528.95. All the other Nifty sectoral indices also fell as volatility rose during the session.

Own property in India? Why you must fix any paperwork issues nowIn fact, for years, the biggest property scam in India has been when someone who isn't the real owner sells a property. The buyer, after paying a huge amount, later finds out they were cheated, and the actual owner was someone else all along.

ITR filing made easy: Here's a simple step-by-step guide to file income tax returnBefore starting your income tax return, ensure you have key documents in hand. These include Form 16 from your employer, Form 26AS, the Annual Information Statement (AIS) and Tax Information Statement (TIS) from the income tax portal, and your bank statements.

entertainment.headline: Thug Life review: Kamal Haasan, Silambarasan's gangster drama soars, then sinksReleased-Thu Jun 05, 2025Thug Life Review: Directed by Mani Ratnam, 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, is a gangster drama with emotional beats. While the film had a great set-up pre-interval, it falls into a deep pit in the second half and there is no turning back – even for a legend like Mani Ratnam.

Samjha karo: Arbaaz Khan's request to paps sparks pregnancy buzz about wife SshuraArbaaz Khan and wife Sshura Khan were spotted during a family outing in Mumbai, sparking pregnancy rumours. Arbaaz's request for privacy from paparazzi further hinted at the couple expecting their first child together.

Wicked 2 trailer: Cynthia Erivo-Ariana Grande reunite in battle against wizardThe second act of the American musical fantasy featuring Cynthia Erivo and Ariana Grande is back. The trailer for 'Wicked 2' shows Elphaba and Glinda reuniting amidst witchcraft, spells, flying monkeys while fighting an evil wizard.

Dakota Johnson-Chris Martin break up after dating for 8 years: ReportActor Dakota Johnson and singer Chris Martin have allegedly broken up after dating for 8 years. Reports say "the break-up seems final this time."

Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan teaser: Vikrant, Shanaya and their love beyond sightThe teaser of 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan' introduces a love story between Vikrant Massey and debutant Shanaya Kapoor. Set against a monsoon backdrop, the film explores love that begins with a chance meeting and is tested by life's unexpected turns.

Janhvi Kapoor's custom jacket pays tribute to Sridevi-Chiranjeevi's classic filmActor Janhvi Kapoor recently watched her mother Sridevi's and Chirenajeevi Konidela's classic film 'Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari'. She even paid tribute to the film with a custom jacket.

Kamal Haasan, R Madhavan, Sonu Sood, celebs mourn Bengaluru stampede tragedyA huge crowd gathered outside the Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru on Wednesday to celebrate Royal Challengers Bengaluru's victory march following their IPL win. The government said 11 were killed in a stampede right outside the stadium. The celebs from the film industry offered condolences.

Alia Bhatt shares pics of the most beautiful bride and wedding that felt like homeAlia Bhatt attended her best friend Tanya Saha Gupta's wedding in Spain. She played the bridesmaid and shared dreamy moments from the celebrations.

Anil Kapoor celebrates 10 years of Dil Dhadakne Do'Dil Dhadakne Do' completes 10 years of film release today (June 5). On the ocassion, Anil Kapoor has shared throwback photos on his social media account.

Exclusive: Sara Ali Khan teams up with Aanand L Rai for next filmActor Sara Ali Khan has teamed up with director Aanand L Rai for her next film. The much-anticipated project is set to present her in a very different avatar.

Thug Life X review: Kamal Haasan's film is unconventional, gives goosebumpsKamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' is receiving all kinds of reviews from fans on social media. While many feel that this Silambarasan TR has overshadowed Haasan in the film, others feel that the background music is not up to the mark.

Head of State new trailer: Priyanka, John Cena, Idris Elba promise explosive actionPriyanka Chopra, John Cena, and Idris Elba's upcoming film 'Heads of State ' is set to entertain fans on July 2. Ahead of the grand premiere on Prime Video, the makers released another powerful trailer.

The Better Sister review: Power, patriarchy and murder in a brilliantly layered showReleased-Thu May 29, 2025'The Better Sister', co-created by Olivia Milch and Regina Corrado, is streaming on Prime Video. The show featuring Jessica Biel and Elizabeth Banks is an intriguing whodunnit with stellar performances.

Actor Joju George shares video of daughter singing Thug Life song MuthamazhaiA cute video of actor Joju George singing the 'Muthamazhai' song from 'Thug Life' alongside his daughter Sara has gone viral on social media, charming fans with its candid warmth.

Thug Life box office prediction day 1: Kamal Haasan film to roar on opening dayKamal Haasan and Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' is out to set the cash registers ringing at the box office. The opening-day looks solid with a packed audience in theatres, and the advance booking numbers echo the same. Check the detailed report here.

Diddy accused of dangling woman off 17-story balcony in ongoing sex traffickingHip-hop mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs is on trial for sex trafficking and racketeering. A witness testified he dangled her off a 17-story balcony in 2016.

'Wicked: For Good' trailer to debut in Arizona theaters on June 4The Wicked: For Good trailer premieres in theaters on June 4, 2025, during a special rerelease of Part 1 at select Arizona Harkins locations. Streaming options are also available.

Raghav Juyal injures leg while shooting for Shah Rukh Khan's King: ReportRaghav Juyal got injured while shooting a tough stunt for Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming film 'King' but continued filming afterward. The movie, releasing in 2026, features a star-studded cast including SRK, Suhana Khan, Deepika Padukone, and more.

Shanaya Kapoor-Vikrant Massey's Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan first look outShanaya Kapoor is set to make her Bollywood debut opposite Vikrant Massey in the romantic drama 'Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan'. The film's first look has been unveiled and is already generating buzz.

general news.headline: Influencer Sharmishta Panoli gets interim bail in Op Sindoor post caseThe Calcutta High Court has granted interim bail to the 22-year-old fourth-year law student from Pune, Sharmishta Panoli. She was arrested on May 30 in Gurugram in connection with a post related to Operation Sindoor.

Bengaluru stampede live: Hearing begins in Karnataka High CourtThe Karnataka High Court has begun hearing the Chinnaswamy Stadium stampede case after it took cognisance of the matter on its own earlier in the day. The court has sought a government report on security lapses. As many as 11 people were killed and 47 others were injured in the stampede during a felicitation event for Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) following their IPL victory.

As thousands gathered to celebrate, the situation turned tragic. The stadium could accommodate only 30,000 people, but over 2 lakh RCB fans showed up. While the players were being honoured inside, the road outside became uncontrollable, leading to the stampede.

Government ignored Bengaluru cops' request to hold RCB event on Sunday: SourcesThe Karnataka government insisted on holding the felicitation event for Royal Challengers Bengaluru the day after their victory, despite Bengaluru Police requesting it be moved to the weekend, top sources revealed.

Teens, dancer, jobseekers: The 11 lives lost in Bengaluru RCB event stampedeFans climbed trees, walls, and gates to enter Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru after mixed messages about the RCB event venue spread. Moments later, a stampede left 11 dead and 47 injured.

IPL final: Undoubtedly Virat Kohli's night, but RCB mates deserved moreVirat Kohli was undoubtedly the main man on the night of RCB's ultimate triumph. But there were others who deserved recognition as well. Kohli seemed to sense the stories left untold even in the haze of victory.

How Tharoor hit Trump, Rahul Gandhi with a single stone on ceasefireTrump's claim of brokering a ceasefire between India and Pakistan has been used by the Congress and its leaders, including Rahul Gandhi, to attack PM Narendra Modi. But why hasn't India vociferously rejected Trump's claim? Congress MP Shashi Tharoor revealed why the Indian government has been diplomatic in rejecting Trump's claims, and destroyed Rahul's arguments too.

Trinamool MP Mahua Moitra marries former BJD MP Pinaki Misra in ceremony abroadMahua Moitra and BJD leader Pinaki Misra, both sitting Lok Sabha members, have reportedly married in a quiet overseas ceremony.

Those children…: DK Shivakumar, under fire, breaks down over stampede deathsKarnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar broke down while addressing the media about the stampede at Chinnaswamy Stadium which claimed the lives of 11 people. He expressed sorrow over the deaths and recounted the chaos.

Thug Life X review: Kamal Haasan's film is unconventional, gives goosebumpsKamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' is receiving all kinds of reviews from fans on social media. While many feel that this Silambarasan TR has overshadowed Haasan in the film, others feel that the background music is not up to the mark.

Even after knowing about deaths, Siddaramaiah went to eat halwa, dosa: BJPThe BJP alleges that the Bengaluru stampede began even before Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah reached the venue. They claimed he knew of the deaths but still went ahead with the event and went to a hotel to eat badam halwa.

Rare Gandhi portrait, for which he agreed to sit, on sale in LondonA rare 1931 portrait of Mahatma Gandhi, for which he agreed to sit and pose, is set to be auctioned in London this July, with an estimated price of 50,000-70,000 pounds. The portrait, by British artist Clare Leighton during Gandhi's visit to London, was reportedly attacked by a Hindu right-wing activist.

Why China engages in diplomacy of silence on PakistanChina has used diplomacy of silence on the India-Pakistan issue for decades. Even as Pakistan deployed several Chinese weapons against India during the recent conflict, Beijing, by not supporting Islamabad publicly, reinforced its aspirations -- a power broker that shapes the polities of the Asia-Pacific, and an arms supplier.

A brief political history of Operation BluestarOperation Bluestar was launched by the Indian Army to remove Sikh militants from Amritsar's Golden Temple. Rooted in decades of political, religious, and separatist tensions, the operation left lasting scars on India's social and historical fabric.

Give my child back: Father whose son died in Bengaluru stampede refuses postmortemHis son was one of the 11 cricket fans who lost their lives in a tragic stampede during a chaotic celebration at Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium last evening.

Government to count castes, not classes in 2027 census: SourcesThe 2027 Census will record individuals' self-declared castes but not categorise them into OBC, SC, or ST groups, sources told India Today TV.

Row over Congress Minister's son granted stage access at Vidhana Soudha RCB eventThe Karnataka BJP criticises the government for allowing Congress Minister's sons on stage while the public was denied entry to the Vidhana Soudha felicitation for Royal Challengers Bengaluru's IPL victory.

Meghan Markle posts throwback dance video from pregnancy with LilibetIn the video, shot from her hospital room shortly before she went into labour, Meghan Markle is seen grooving to a song called Baby Mama in a black dress, alongside the Duke of Sussex, Prince Harry, as part of a TikTok challenge.

India never asked anyone: Shashi Tharoor reacts to Rahul Gandhi's 'surrender' jibeWhen asked about his party leader Rahul Gandhi's 'Narender surrender' remark on Operation Sindoor, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor reiterated that there was no third-party intervention at any point.

Stampede blame game? Government says RCB, Karnataka cricket body wanted eventAmid the criticism over the stampede and alleged negligence of crowd control, the Karnataka government revealed that the event was organised at the request of RCB and the state cricket association.

We don't want them: Trump issues travel ban on 12 countries, restrictions on 7The countries facing the total ban were found to be 'deficient in screening and vetting' and were determined to pose a very high risk to the United States, according to a statement from the White House.

Alia Bhatt shares pics of the most beautiful bride and wedding that felt like homeAlia Bhatt attended her best friend Tanya Saha Gupta's wedding in Spain. She played the bridesmaid and shared dreamy moments from the celebrations.

Tejasvi Surya blasts Bhutto in US: India gives tech titans, Pak gives terroristsBJP MP Tejasvi Surya slammed Pakistan's image, contrasting Indian achievers with terrorists, mocked its Chinese arms dependency, and declared global support firmly behind India. He accused Pakistan of playing the victim abroad while arming itself with low-grade Chinese weaponry.

Mixed messages, shameless apathy, whataboutery: Bengaluru stampede nightmareAs the players were being felicitated inside, complete chaos unfolded on the road and 11 people lost their lives while another 47 were injured. Despite the tragedy just outside, the felicitation ceremony continued.

Trump bans visas for new foreign students at Harvard: Threat to national securityPresident Trump signed a proclamation restricting foreign students from entering Harvard University, citing national security concerns. The order halts new F, M, and J visas for Harvard to the review of existing visas.

sports.headline: England name squad for 1st India Test, all-rounder returns after 3 yearsChris Woakes, Jamie Overton and Jamie Overton made their comebacks as England named their squad for the opening Test against India to be held from June 20 at Headingley in Leeds.

ENG vs IND, press conference LIVE: Gambhir, Shubman to address pressIndia tour of England press conference live: India's new Test captain Shubman Gill and head coach Gautam Gambhir will be addressing the press conference before leaving for England for the upcoming Test series. India and England will lock horn in a five-match series beginning from June 20.

Bengaluru stampede: Mandhana heartbroken as chaos unfolds after IPL finalIndian women's cricketer Smriti Mandhana reacted to the tragic stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru, which took place after Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) won their maiden Indian Premier League (IPL) title by defeating Punjab Kings in the final.

Evolved batter Virat Kohli shut down strike-rate critics in IPL 2025: Cheteshwar PujaraCheteshwar Pujara feels that Virat Kohli evolved as a batter during the IPL 2025 season and shut down his strike-rate critics with his performance. Kohli played a starring role as RCB won the IPL title for the first time.

RCB win IPL 2025, PSG clinch Champions League: Two iconic triumphs, one blueprintIn a year when glitter gave way to grit, RCB and PSG finally ended their painful waits. By trading star power for structure, both sides found glory, not through individuals, but as a team.

Carlsen produced an angry reaction after he was beaten by Gukesh recently in the tournament.

Susan Polgar praises PM Modi for continuous support to D GukeshLegendary chess player Susan Polgar praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi for his continuous support to Indian chess players and interest in the sport.

Simone Inzaghi appointed as Al-Hilal manager after leaving Inter MilanAl-Hilal has announced the appointment of Simone Inzaghi as their new manager after the Italian left Inter Milan after their Champions League final loss. Inzaghi's first assignment as coach will be the FIFA Club World Cup in June.

Shreyas Iyer's shot in IPL final was a criminal offence in my book: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh has lashed out at the Punjab Kings (PBKS) captain Shreyas Iyer for his poor shot selection in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB).

Inzaghi's first assignment as coach will be the FIFA Club World Cup in June.

Shreyas Iyer's shot in IPL final was a criminal offence in my book: Yograj SinghFormer India cricketer Yograj Singh has lashed out at the Punjab Kings (PBKS) captain Shreyas Iyer for his poor shot selection in the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) final against Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB).

French Open Day 12 Order Of Play: Sabalenka vs Swiatek, Gauff faces in-form BoissonThe French Open 2025 has reached its business end as the women's singles semi-finals begins on Thursday, June 5. Iga Swiatek and Aryna Sabalenka will lock horns in a mega clash while Coco Gauff will be up against the wildcard Lois Boisson.

Novak Djokovic ready for semi-final challenge against Perfect Jannik SinnerNovak Djokovic said that he's eagerly looking forward to taking on Jannik Sinner in the semi-final of the French Open 2025. Djokovic beat Alexander Zverev 4-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-4  n the quarterfinals to enter the semi finals.

Cristiano Ronaldo scores winner as Portugal beat Germany to enter Nations League finalCristiano Ronaldo bagged the winner as Portugal defeated Germany for the first time since 2000 to enter the Nations League final. Portugal came from a goal behind to win the match 2-1 on June 4.

After Virat Kohli, AB de Villiers condoles Bengaluru stampede victimsFormer South Africa and Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) batter AB de Villiers expressed his condolences to the victims of the stampede at the M. Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru. At least 11 people were dead, and nearly 50 were injured as a deadly stampede broke out outside the stadium.

Djokovic outlasts Zverev, becomes oldest semifinalist in 57 yearsFrench Open 2025: Novak Djokovic went through to the semi-final of the Roland Garros after beating Alexander Zverev 4-6, 6-3, 6-2. 6-4 in three hours and 17 minutes on Centre Court.

World No. 361 Lois Bosson lost for words as Paris fairytale continuesLois Boisson, 22, entered the Roland Garros as No. 369 in women's singles tennis. The Frenchwoman has taken out two top-10 players -- Jessica Pegula and Mirra Andreeva -- to script a fairytale run at home.

RCB victory parade stampede: Sachin Tendulkar, Yuvraj condole loss of livesRCB victory parade stampede: India's legendary batter Sachin Tendulkar and World Cup-winning all-rounder Yuvraj Singh expressed their condolences over the "tragic" stampede near Bengaluru's M Chinnaswamy Stadium on Wednesday, which claimed 11 lives.

Jannik Sinner emulates Rafael Nadal, storms into 2nd successive semi-finalWorld No. 1 Jannik Sinner continued his relentless pursuit of a maiden French Open title with a typically efficient 6-1, 7-5, 6-0 win over Kazakh showman Alexander Bublik on Wednesday to reach the semi-finals.

Absolutely gutted: Virat Kohli reacts to Bengaluru stampede during RCB eventRCB star Virat Kohli said he was lost for words as he mourned the loss of lives and injuries in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru during the team's IPL celebration on Wednesday, June 4.

BCCI had no knowledge of RCB celebrations: IPL chairman on Bengaluru stampedeIPL Chairman Arun Dhumal called the stampede tragic but clarified that the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) had no knowledge of Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) victory celebration in Bengaluru.

India lose 0-2 to Thailand in football friendly before AFC Asian Cup qualifierIndia lost 0-2 to Thailand in an international football friendly match at Thammasat Stadium, with goals from Ben Davis and Poramet Arjvilai securing a comfortable victory for the under-strength hosts.

Promptly amended program: RCB reacts to Bengaluru stampede, condoles deathsRoyal Challengers Bengaluru and Karnataka State Cricket Association mourned the death of 11 people in a stampede outside the M Chinnaswamy Stadium during the team's IPL victory celebrations on Wednesday, June 4.

Bengaluru stampede tragic, RCB celebration not a BCCI event: IPL chairmanIPL chairman Arun Dhumal clarified that Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) victory celebration in Bengaluru was not organised by the Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI).

PSG describe UCL win emotions with viral Gukesh-Carlsen reaction memeParis Saint-Germain celebrated their maiden Champions League title by drawing a fun parallel with Indian chess World Champion D Gukesh's viral win over Magnus Carlsen, sharing his emotional reaction to reflect their own long-awaited triumph.

Wildcard Lois Boisson stuns Andreeva, joins Coco Gauff in semi-finalWorld No. 361 Loïs Boisson stunned Mirra Andreeva to book her place in the semi-finals, while Coco Gauff huffed and puffed her way into the last four with a hard-fought 6-7(6), 6-4, 6-1 win over fellow American Madison Keys.

Lapses at RCB event, BCCI had no role: Cricket body official on stampedeIndian cricket board secretary Devajit Saikia said the organisers of the IPL victory celebrations in Bengaluru needed better planning. 11 died due to a stampede when thousands gathered to watch the team at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Virat Kohli leads RCB's IPL victory celebrations at M Chinnaswamy stadiumRoyal Challengers Bengaluru celebrated their IPL 2025 triumph in front of a massive home crowd at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium, with star Virat Kohli and skipper Rajat Patidar leading the ceremony. Tragically, a stampede led to reported fan fatalities.

Bengaluru IPL celebrations: Virat Kohli, RCB teammates honoured with Mysore PetaVirat Kohli and his RCB teammates were felicitated with traditional Mysore Petas—ceremonial turbans—and garlands of cardamom by Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah.

Virat Kohli thanks RCB fans at Bengaluru bash: No fanbase like this in the worldIPL 2025: Batting star Virat Kohli addressed a huge gathering of fans at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium, calling them the best in the world. RCB celebrated their IPL triumph with fans in Bengaluru on Wednesday, June 04.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
